ibis.ipl

Interface ReadMessage


  • public interface ReadMessage
    The Ibis abstraction for data to be read.

    A ReadMessage is obtained from a receiveport, either by means of an upcall, or by means of an explicit receive, which is accomplished by call to receive. A receiveport can be configured to generate upcalls or to support blocking receive, but NOT both! At most one ReadMessage is alive at one time for a given ReceivePort.

    For all read methods in this class, the invariant is that the reads must match the writes one by one. An exception to this rule is that an array written with any of the writeArray methods of WriteMessage can be read by readObject(). Likewise, an array written with the WriteMessage.writeByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer) method can be read by readObject() (resulting in a byte array), and also by the readArray(byte[]) method. In contrast, an array written with writeObject cannot be read with readArray, because writeObject does duplicate detection, and may have written only a handle. However, an array written with WriteMessage.writeArray(byte[]) can be read with readByteBuffer(ByteBuffer).

    • Method Detail

      • finish

        long finish()
     throws java.io.IOException
        The finish operation is used to indicate that the reader is done with the message. After the finish, no more bytes can be read from the message, and other information obtained from the message, such as bytesRead() is no longer available. Implementations are explicitly allowed to reuse the message object.

        The thread reading the message (can be an upcall) is not allowed to block when a message is alive but not finished. Only after the finish is called can the thread that holds the message block. The finish operation must always be called when blocking receive is used. When upcalls are used, the finish can be avoided when the user is sure that the upcall never blocks or waits for a message to arrive. In that case, the message is automatically finished when the upcall terminates. This is much more efficient, because in this way, the runtime system can reuse the upcall thread!

        Returns:
        the number of bytes read from this message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred.

      • finish

        void finish(java.io.IOException exception)
        This method can be used to inform Ibis that one of the ReadMessage methods has thrown an IOException. It implies a finish(). In a message upcall, the alternative way to do this is to have the upcall throw the exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception that was thrown.

      • bytesRead

        long bytesRead()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of bytes read from this message. Note that for streaming implementations (i.e., messages with an unlimited capacity) this number may not be exact because of intermediate buffering. When finish() has been called on the message, this information can no longer be trusted.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read sofar from this message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred.

      • size

        int size()
  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the size of this message in bytes. When finish() has been called on the message, this information can no longer be trusted.
        Returns:
        the size of this message in byte or -1 if the size is unknown or unlimited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred.

      • remaining

        int remaining()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the remaining number bytes available for reading in this message.
        Returns:
        the number remaining bytes available for reading in this message or -1 if the message size is unknown or unlimited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred.

      • localPort

        ReceivePort localPort()
        Returns the receiveport of this ReadMessage. When finish() has been called on the message, this information can no longer be trusted.
        Returns:
        the receiveport of this ReadMessage.

      • sequenceNumber

        long sequenceNumber()
        Returns the sequence number of this message. When finish() has been called on the message, this information can no longer be trusted.
        Returns:
        the sequence number for this message.
        Throws:
        IbisConfigurationException - is thrown if the port type of the receive port does not have the PortType.COMMUNICATION_NUMBERED capability.

      • origin

        SendPortIdentifier origin()
        Returns the sendport identifier of the sender of this message. When finish() has been called on the message, this information can no longer be trusted.
        Returns:
        the id of the sender of this message.

        boolean readBoolean()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a boolean value from the message. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE).
        Returns:
        the value read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

      • readObject

        java.lang.Object readObject()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads an Object value from the message. Note: implementations should take care that an array, written with one of the writeArray variants, can be read with readObject. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream cannot do object serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_OBJECT).
        Returns:
        the value read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - is thrown when an object arrives of a class that cannot be loaded locally.

      • readArray

        void readArray(boolean[] destination)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Receives an array in place. This method is a shortcut for readArray(destination, 0, destination.length); This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE).
        Parameters:
        destination - where the received array is stored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an IO error occurs.

      • readByteBuffer

        void readByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.nio.ReadOnlyBufferException
        Reads into the contents of the byte buffer (between its current position and its limit). This method is allowed for all serialization types, even PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE.
        Parameters:
        value - the byte buffer from which data is to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred
        java.nio.ReadOnlyBufferException - is thrown when the buffer is read-only.
